page.title: 02STOTFOLD a dormitory town
page.content: Stotfold has a population of about 7,600.It is situated on the southern border of the county near the industrial centres of{North Herts}. Maps from the 1800's show that Stotfold was built around the{church}, the{High Street}and the{River Ivel}. Which supported two mills. The church dates from the 12th century but was modified in the 1890's.The{font}and{clerestry}are perpendicular. Stotfold attracted several other religious groups in victorian times. There are now two{Methodist chapels}, one{Salvation Army Hall}and two{ {Baptist Churches}in the town. A defunct industry of the town is the straw trade which supported the {Luton Hat Industry}. Modern Stotfold has developed as a dormitory town which provides the
